Although it failed to turn a profit at the box office, I trust later incarnations in VHS and DVD have remedied that. Today, our children read fairy tales that go back centuries.  I would be very surprised if some 23rd century viewer wasn't charmed by this film no matter what the media.  Bravo to the actors, the writer, the producer and director.  Yes and to Norman Lear, who footed the bill. You did yourselves proud.

title: A Film everyone should see
content: I have yet to meet a person who watched this move and didn't find it evnjoyable. It's a simple, yet innovative idea: they made a classic, archetypical Dark Ages hero/romance flick, but set it right on the edge between satire and earnestness. The whole story is, supposedly, a book a grandfather (Peter Falk) reads to his sick grandkid (Fred Savage). It should tell you all you need to know about this film when, the first time the two estranged lovers find each other and embrace, you all of the sudden hear, "Wait, I don't wanna hear about kissing."The principle actors here are all very good. Cary Elwes is fine as our dashing hero. Mandy Patinkin is his foil/friend, with his own subplot. Robin Wright is fine as the damsel in love and distress, and Chris Sarandon makes a good evil, scheming villain, and he's a highly underrated character actor (see "Dog Day Afternoon" if you don't believe me).The real beauty of this film, however, is the performances turned in by such actors as Wallace Shawn, Billy Crystal, Carol, Kane, and that noted thespian, Andre the Giant. Shawn, for instance, is the con man with a list who is the early (not final) villain. His character is short, has a lisp, and uses the same word (he prounounces it "inconthievable") to address every situation (which leads to the best quote of the film, Patinkin's response "You keep using that word. I do not think it means what you think it means.") It's this kind of dialogue that seems out of place in such an action/romance film. "The African Queen" or something or the like, while being fine movies, would never have a character like Billy Crystal's "Miracle Max", who plays a sort of caricature of a Jewish parent (to me, anyway).The beauty of this film is that you aren't quite sure if you should be laughing, or should be caught up in the story, and the beauty is that you can do both.

title: The Princess Bride OKish
content: The princess bride ushers you into a mystical world of giants, pirates, and castles. This 1987 fairytale spoof has all the right intentions, like the story being read from grandfather to grandson it seems like it would be a nice way to just relax on a lazy day, or a day when you are sick. it's a harmless film but lacked something for me.Rob Reiner (This Is Spinal Tap) directed this film which is based on the novel of the same name by William Goldman who as well wrote the screenplay. The story begins with a sick child (Fred Savage) being read a fairytale by his grandfather (Peter Falk). Quickly we are whisked away as well with the grandson who at first is dreading the fairytale story. The story introduces us too Buttercup (Robin Wright Penn) and Westley (Carey Elwes) a couple who are madly in love. Immediately we are told that Westley must leave Buttercup for no apparent reason. Quickly Buttercup is kidnapped by three pirate like men, Inigo Montoya (Mandy Patinkin), Vizzini (Wallace Shawn), and Fezzik (André The Giant). It seems like they are being followed by a Zorro-esquire character which quickly eliminates one of the kidnappers one at a time. It quickly becomes repetitive but that's not the least of the problems here. 'Zorro' quickly makes it through the kidnappers using swords, poison, and his own hands. Later on the princess is endangered by the prince of her land who plans a marriage.One of the major problems to me with the film is the continuation of certain aspects. An example of which was when the kidnappers and the princess make it up the mountain cliff by climbing, after they move on the prince somehow managed to reach the top of the mountain with the rest of his crew which includes a large number of horses. The props at times seem fake but mostly are average, the acting is OK, but the laughs just don't come. The movie sets out to spoof fairy tale movies and do, in some ways, succeed, but rarely did I laugh out loud when a joke was delivered, and in some ways these moments don't even spoof or satirize this classification of films. The film has its moments, I thought the poison scene was clever at best, but overall I was displeased with this film. If I was recommending a spoof of these types of films I would much rather recommend the 'Shrek' movies. I truly dreaded this film experience around 5 minutes in when we were jumped around making me feel overwhelmed and rushed, overall it was a unique experience which I do not think I will revisit.

title: a great parody on fairy tales!
content: It definitely starts out as a cheesy, girly fairytale... It's so sappy, it makes you laugh! But then it has an actual plot, which is exciting and unpredictable! This is one movie that I could watch time and time again and never become bored with it! I can nearly quote every line of the movie, and I still enjoy each viewing just as much as the last! I can't say there are any great values presented - although there's nothing questionable, really - but it's just a fun movie to sit down and laugh at. I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys a good laugh at some REALLY funny stuff - not just the ordinary, cookie cutter jokes that most other movies provide. I also loved the storyline - it was cute and touching, and while the outcome was obvious from the beginning (as all fairy tales are), the path on which the characters would take to produce such an outcome was very interesting. It is a great movie! I strongly recommend it!

title: "Have fun storming the castle!" - Miracle Max
content: This was the "Shrek" of the eighties (although I'll be the first to say that it's more accurate to call "Shrek" the "Princess Bride" of 2K01).  Adults going in didn't like the idea of having to drag their kids to a "fairy tale" movie, and came out laughing hardest of all.Adorable, romantic, and quotable as heck, this is a must-see!

title: A Masterpiece
content: Funny, exciting, and endlessly quotable, The Princess Bride is a classic.

title: This is a must-see classic!
content: This is one of the funniest movies ever made.  It's a classic!  There are so many memorable, quotable lines.  It's an amazing script carried out beautifully by an amazing cast and crew.  I've never met anyone who didn't love this movie.

title: Inconceivable!
content: This has always been one of my all time favorite movies.  I bought the DVD recently and watched it for the umpteenth time and it  amazes me that even though I practically know the film by heart, I still laugh throughout. The performances are universally excellent, especially Elwes and Wright as the leads and Patinkin who delivers one of the most famous lines in movie history (at least as far as my generation goes.)  And that brings me to my point in this review: this should be a classic for EVERYONE.  I'm a teacher, and I've asked my students if they've seen this movie (eighth graders) and the majority of them have not.  This absolutely amazes me.  My instant response is: "Go get it.  You will love this movie, I promise."  To this day I have not met someone who dislikes The Princess Bride -- and really, how could you?  Comedy, adventure, romance...it's all here!As is true of most movies from books, the source material IS better than the film, but I didn't read the book until years after the movie had become a cultural touchstone.  So once you've seen the movie, do yourself a a favor and read the book -- you'll be enchanted all over again.

title: One of the most quotable movies in existence.
content: I first watched this movie about 5 years ago with my dad. He had loved it, and decided to force my sister and I to watch it. We were immediately turned off by the title. The Princess Bride? Sounds like a rather stupid film.It wasn't. For the duration of the film, my sister and I were entranced. Then we watched it again. Before long, we could recite half the movie.Then, a few years later, we were having out annual Halloween Movie Fest. We decided, on a whim, to watch the Princess Bride with, say, 5 or 6 of our friends. Half had seen it before, the others never had. Well, needless to say, they learned quickly. Within minutes, we were all going along with Vizzini's infamous "Inconcievable!", and laughing our heads off.If you enjoy movies that have a nice blend of action, comedy, and a little romance, then this movie is great for you. If not, watch it anyway. You may be surprised.

title: Great Movie
content: I know there are a million people out there that say this is the greatest movie ever.  I can't say that I agree, don't get me wrong, it's a great movie!  I would recommend this movie to just about everyone, but it isn't one of my all-time favorites.  Anyway, if you haven't seen this movie yet, why are you still reading this reviews?  The critics agree, it's definitely worth a look-see.  Hope you enjoy it.  -Cortex

title: A gentle, whimsical classic
content: I saw this film when it first came out in theatres. I was twelve at the time. In my unusually self-important childhood wisdom, I declared to all of my friends and relations that "The Princess Bride" was the best film of 1987. I suppose I was attempting to become the next Roger Ebert at the time. Now that I'm older, and I've seen many of the more seriously acclaimed films of that year, I still think I was right at the time.Has any film ever satirized a story form(in this case, the fairy tale) while embodying that form so perfectly? And has there ever been a fight scene written so intelligently as Westley and Inigo's duel? This film is a joy from start to finish, and it is one I will treasure for as long as I live.

title: The best there is...
content: I saw the general heading of The Perfect Movie, and how could you not agree. This movie has everything.  It is the perfect movie about perfect people with the perfect love and the best swordfight ever seen.  Need more? Fencing, fighting, true love, miracles, monsters, giants, and more!  If you haven't seen it...do yourself a favor and WATCH IT!

title: Fun for the whole family
content: Feel good movie.  Watched it for the fifth time and it's still brings smiles.

title: My Favorite film, no question.
content: For such a simple film, this has left a huge impression. From the coolest sword fight ever, to the best performance by a rhyming wrestler, this film in perfect for everyone who still thinks Marilyn Manson is just a freako, and not the holder of ultimate truth in the universe. Billy Crystal must wish he had more roles like this after his recent crapolla and Cary Elwes should have been the coolest guy in the universe after this. (Maybe he ran over a cat or something.) If you know any children, turn off Minecraft, and force them to watch this. And sit down with them, you'll love it. Oh, ans since I'm editing this, and the new rules are forcing me to make the review longer. Read the Book too. It's quite different, but both are works of art in their own ways.

title: One of the greatest children's films ever.
content: A marvel of a movie that celebrates, while simultaneously laughing at, the absurdity of fantasy storytelling, managing the near impossible task of equal amounts cynicism and sincerity throughout. The pacing is remarkable, each scene moving breathlessly into the next like an exhaustively choreographed sword fight. Nearly every scene is perfect: wine drinking, Inigo's revenge, Westley's threatening speech to Humperdink, even the framing in Savage's bedroom.

title: The princess bride is to fantasy is as Chucky is to horror.
content: Before I begin there are a few times I will make comments as to certain parts of the story and specific details but I do not reveal any critical points in the story. To start the story itself is horrible. I admit it has a few good characters, I enjoyed the spainard. The first time I saw it it was easy to tell what would be happening 10 minutes ahead. The simplicity of it all was dumbfounding. The story is nothing more than cliche. Several people I know seem to like it some how in one way or another, something I dont seem to understand. The acting I found to be subpar but acceptable given the roles. Andre the Giant, as he has become known as, fit the role of his character very well from a physicly ominious standpoint, but his poor diction detracted from the moment most any time that he spoke. The Vizzini character was utterly annoying through and through. As for Cary Elwes, his performance I felt was decent given the seemingly two dimensional persona that the script gave him to work with. Something that really got on my nerves was how that it was chosen to retain the annoyence from the book of using that horrible acronym: ROUS. Rodents Of Unusual Size. Its one thing to include a rodent as an enemy but its quite another thing in the way they handles the scene with the rodents. When Elwes's character was attacked by one of these "rous"s  he was even pinned down by this animal half his size. To me this was a horrible way to handle it. It reminded me much of chucky *shudders* (now THAT was a horrible movie) where a childs doll somehow had the weight and strength to pin down grown people. The physics of it just dont make any sense. My ultimate opinion is this. As a satire, mocking the fantasy genre, it was a masterpiece of its time. As a fantasy (which is what its listed as for some reason), it was an abomination and a slap in the face to the rest of the genre in my opinion. I cant quite put my finger on a specific of why i loathe it so much, but to sit and watch it makes me sick.Would i Reccomend this movie? If you havent seen it: yes. I have heard enough good things from other people that odds are you may enjoy it too, so you might as well struggle through it once.

title: My favourite movie? As you wish
content: Oh, how I love this movie. The weeklong illness was the best of my life, garnering me two showings of this film per day! I can quote every line, and so often do, when I'm watching - mother gets most annoyed!!I really cannot think of a more perfect film to curl up to when you're feeling down and depressed. It's all been said before, hasn't it?!Of course there are cheesy bits, but those are the bits I love most "Have fun storming the castle," "Think it'll work?" "It'd take a miracle" when Miracle Max is waving the good guys on their way. Every moment for me is sheer joy (although when I introduced it to my friends here at uni, none of them cared much for it) but I cannot think how anyone couldn't be uplifted by it.I should stop raving about it, I'm too biased for a fair opinion, I've been watching this film for years and don't think I'll ever stop!!

title: The Princess Bride: Greatest Film ever made
content: I really love this movie and the book. I could watch it over and over (and frequently do).Its a story of True Love and High Adventure.Great lines, great characters, great scenery.You may get the feeling I like this movie.Mandy Patinkin is great as Inigo Montoya and his line "Hallo, I am Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, prepare to die" goes down as one of my favourite quotes.If you haven't seen it yet, you are missing out.why are you still reading this? Go see the film now!Xyzandra.

title: One of my Top 10 - definitely
content: I saw this film for the first time in a crowded cafeteria at Geneva College in 1987.  I remember little about it, other than the *huge* cheer of the crowd when Count Rugen turns tail and runs when Inigo confronts him in the castle.It is definitely a movie that grows on you.  I have downloaded (and edited!) a copy of the script, made a Windows theme, and like many of you, have committed much of the movie to memory.  It was also one of the first movies I watched with my wife when we were still dating.It's one of those movies that you can watch again and again.  The subtle humor, one-liners, and satire of The Princess Bride make it one of my favorite movies of all time.

title: My very favorite movie...
content: I love this movie.  The artistic camera shots, the humor, the acting, the fantasy, the music... it's my all-time favorite.  I think everyone has to see this movie at least once in their life... I don't know how many times I've seen it!  If you need a suggestion for a great movie to rent sometime when you're bored, GET THIS ONE.  You can't be disappointed!!!

title: Goldman rules
content: William Goldman's plot is as entertaining and exciting as the book!! It is INCONCEIVABLE not to fall in love with this classic!    Pay attention to every single sentence in the dialogs and actor's expressions!

title: Great Movie!
content: This is by far the greatest movie ever made!  Well, at least the greatest comedy!  Cary Elwes is brilliant as Westley, and who could every forget Inigo's "Prepare to die"?  Andre the Giant turns in his best role ever (and remember, he was a professional wrestler, so he's done a whole lotta acting).  A star-studded cast with Rob Reiner in his greatest directorial effort.  I've seen this many, many times and it never gets old -- it's even better when you can say the lines along with the characters!  If you've seen this movie, go see it again...if you haven't, well, go see it!!!

title: Very entertaining and worth watching! Made my night!
content: I came across this title a few days ago. I became curious because of the high ratings and the reviews posted. I was a bit hesitant at first when I saw that it's quite an old flick (1987).Finally, was able to watch this film last night. I can't help but to create an account to register just to rate the movie. How thankful I am that I gave it a try because it really made my night. We enjoyed it a lot! It's an entertaining film. We laughed hard. The characters were great! The film was brilliantly done. The characters were well-chosen. Each one of them portrayed their roles excellently.. There are values to be learned. I loved how polite and well-mannered the main characters were; Westley,, Buttercup, Inigo Montoya, Fezzik. The value of the word, "please," was mentioned. Inigo Montoya was a respectful person and kept saying "thank you" whenever he asks a favor or request from someone. The script is admirable. You can watch this just with anyone; even with your kids. It's a film for all ages. It doesn't contain violence .This film is highly commendable. It's worth watching. When the movie ended, I want more and wished that there's a sequel.

title: Great movie
content: I like this movie because it appeals to all ages. And another unfortunately rare feature NO SWEARING!!!! Which means we all can watch it without having to feel uncomfortable with our younger cousins, siblings watching it. This goes to show you that you can still make a good movie without having all the swearing!

title: My own opinion of the film...
content: In a society so characterized by hate and violence, it is refreshing to occasionally have a film that forgets all those hidden rules and entertains the child inside of us all. The Princess Bride is without a doubt one of these movies! It will almost assuredly make you drop on the floor and roll with laughter. This is Rob Reiners greatest comedy, and not far off from being his finest all together. Reiner not only creates a histaricall movie, but also ties up all the loose ends with unmatched comical acting, and beautiful scenery. From the beginning scene with the sickly child, through the very end, this movie is guaranteed to make you laugh. I only wish that there were more movies like this one.

title: My own opinion of the film...
content: In a society so characterized by hate and violence, it is refreshing to occasionally have a film that forgets all those hidden rules and entertains the child inside of us all. The Princess Bride is without a doubt one of these movies! It will almost assuredly make you drop on the floor and roll with laughter. This is Rob Reiners greatest comedy, and not far off from being his finest all together. Reiner not only creates a hysterical movie, but also ties up all the loose ends with unmatched comical acting, and beautiful scenery. From the beginning scene with the sickly child, through the very end, this movie is guaranteed to make you laugh. I only wish that there were more movies like this one.

title: Put it next to Casablanca
content: For years, while my kids were growing up, I thought this was the best movie ever made. Then I saw Casablanca again, and moved it down to number 2. Get this movie, view it umpteen times with your kids, until they are spouting all the great sound bites verbatim. Then put it on your shelves next to Casablanca. No room on your shelves? Take Citizen Kane and all the other movies you'll never view again and put them in a box and put the box in the attic. Now you have lots of room for fun movies like this one. Add Ghostbusters and All in the Family if you haven't already.Some of those sound bites that you'll remember the movie by:"I beg your pardon, but this is not as easy as it looks.""There is something you should know.  I am not left handed.""Inconceivable!" "I do not think this word means what you think it means.""Get used to disappointment.""Think it will work?" "It would take a miracle.""As you wish.""... some day we'll regret it. Maybe not today ..." (Oh, sorry, wrong movie)

title: I simply love this movie too !!
content: I can say that I experienced love at first sight with this movie when i watched it for the first time.. And all the people I've shown it to enjoyed it just as much as I did (and still do). I know it almost by heart and it has become a game for my brother and I to recite entire parts of the dialogues to each other whenever we happen to meet. My six-year-old brother likes it so much that he sometimes pretends to be Inigo and therefore wants to avenge his father with a sword fight with...his own father ! I think The Princess Bride to be one of the best movies ever.

title: My six year old puts on better shows than this in the back yard.
content: What a load of claptrap. Not only did the movie not make a lot of sense but the acting left a lot to be desired. Scores highly on the sphincter clencher scale. I was also surprised that Peter Falk would lend his talent to a production of this caliber. Maybe he was in need of money, who knows. Anyway, a waste of my money (I was foolish enough to buy the DVD) and of my time.

title: My most favorite movie in all the world....
content: I saw this movie for the first time in 6th grade and I just loved it and I still love it almost 10 years later! I've watched this movie so many times now that I have just about every line memorized (and I know others who are the same!) It satisfies all of the elements of a great movie...a hero and a villian, a lady in distress, action/fights for the lady in distress, suspense and of course, a happy ending! And best of all, it's a movie that almost everyone in the family could watch! I would recommend this flick to anyone who wants to watch an awesome movie!

title: My favourite film (and actor)
content: Superb film, wonderfully tongue in cheek. great cameos.Most of all, given life by an inspired Mandy Patinkin, the greatest singing, acting, sword fighting, cardio thorasic Surgeon in town.

title: Best Movie Ever.
content: How can anyone not like this movie?  It has a little bit of everything; comedy, romance, violence, suspense, mystery, fantasy and so forth.  Wesley and Buttercup live the life that everyone yearns for.  This movie truly gets better every time you watch it.

title: The best "Feel Good" movie out there
content: If you want a movie that's entertaining for the whole family - you will not find one better than The Princess Bride.  It's heart-warming AND entertaining.  It spans all genres.  There's plenty of comedy, drama, action, and even a little horror in the Fire-Swamp.  All age groups love this movie.  We own Video Stop (a chain of video stores in Fort Wayne) and it's nearly impossible to find someone who hasn't seen this movie.  It's nearly as rare to find someone who hasn't thoroughly enjoyed it. A definite 10

title: Inconceivable!!!
content: The Princess Bride is a very beautiful and romantic film. It is also filled with humor, which will make it a cult classic for years to come. Rob Reiner has created his most brilliant film here and the cast is awesome. For anyone to deny liking this film, there has to be something wrong with their imagination. If you don't understand the film, I have only one word for you. INCONCEIVABLE!!!!!

title: Bored
content: I decided to watch this movie because the rate is '8.1' but the movie is so so so much bored and nothing special. The content to so nbormal and nothing inside this movie. Wasted my time.

title: A Classic Childhood Favorite About Love and Adventure
content: https://youtu.be/Ldmi1UeMKd0 The link above contains my full review and summary of the movie. I watched it with my friend Rachel who'd never seen it before, if you can believe that! She liked it a lot (she even cried just a few minutes in!) I've loved this movie for a LONG time. I grew up on silly comedies and action movies like Big Trouble in Little China and Robin Hood: Men in Tights. In fact, I used to confuse Men in Tights with PRINCESS BRIDE because the lead actor is the same in each! The brilliant Carey Elwes! The script is my one of my favorite writers, William Goldman, from his book. If you're a fan of the movie and haven't read the book, you are missing out! The book is just as amazing as the movie and in some ways it's EVEN BETTER.The swordfight on the Cliffs of Insanity, the themes of true love and revenge, the relationship between the boy and his grandfather, the quotable lines and the AMAZING cast, make this a fantastic film. Give it a watch and show it to your friends if they haven't seen it!

title: What can I say about this masterpiece?
content: A fabulous movie! The book is slightly better, but that hardly detracts from a great movie. And a soundtrack by Mark Knopfler, too!It's one of those movies that many people can quote many lines from. Thoroughly enjoyable, and stands up to repeated viewings.

title: Firm agreement
content: One of my all-time favourite films, for all the reasons other reviewers have already covered.This film has it all, and has a gentle humour so sadly lacking in so many films today.

title: What a freakin' studly movie!
content: This has got to be one of THE best movies I have ever seen in my entire life.  It has a little bit of everything.  I HIGHLY recommend this movie to everyone.  I promise that you will not be mad that you saw this awesome movie!

title: How many times have YOU seen it?
content: I think that The Princess Bride is the one movie that I have seen over thirty times. The drama, action, romance, fantasy, and everything else that is intertwined in this movie make it so enjoyable that I can see it over and over and never get sick of it. I thought that the acting on the part of Robin Wright was great and I always enjoy watching Cary Elwes. Just as a side, if anyone else is a Christopher Guest fan (Count Rugen) then I recommend "Waiting For Guffman". Anyway, "The Princess Bride" was a wonderfully done film and I would recommend it to anyone.

title: A smashing success
content: This film is one of those films you bypass on the shelf, avoiding it like it is the never ending story 7. But on closer inspection this movie becomes one of the greatest films ever. Rob Rhiner is my most worshiped director and I feel he does such a good job with this film. The casting was great with robin wright ( introducing ) as the princess bride and the lush westley of the farm. Nice.What can one say. See this film if you haven't already. And if you have buy it on video. I have.I don't know how many times I have waited for a farm boy to say to me...."as you wish..."

title: Don't waste your time.
content: Sorry for being honest, and no offense to the people who've chosen this movie to best their favorite ever made, but my friend and i watched this because we we're told it's beautiful and a classic. We were so bored by about half time, that we literally suffered through the rest of the movie, hoping for it to end in some kind of fruitful way. What a waste of time. P.S. Still i must say, we did both laugh twice. But i wouldn't want to spoiler.If you like love-stories watch s.th. like "eternal sunshine of the spotless mind". Like s.th. old & classic try "Dead Poets' Society" or "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest".I'm pretty sad to not have found real fantasy. i guess i was hoping for s.th. like "sleeping beauty".

title: The cure for what ails you
content: Once I had the flu, and I hurt all over so badly I couldn't sleep. I was trapped on the living room couch, wondering if I'd ever recover, and the only thing that made me feel better was "The Princess Bride." I think I watched it five times that night. That was about 10 years ago, but even today I can't watch just a little of it without watching the whole thing, and I can't watch any of it without smiling. It does an end run around my pessimism and cynicism and gets right at the uncorruptible romantic inside me.

title: My favourite 'sick' film
content: This film is definitely the best film for days when you're off sick, snuggled up in bed and not feeling too hot, which was exactly how it was introduced to me by my mum. It always perks me up no matter what and despite the fact that it was made in the 80s it still rocks and gets better the more times you see it. If you've already seen it but haven't read the book, are you insane?! What are you reading this for? Sprint down to your nearest bookshop and get a copy!! It's "The Princess Bride" by William Goldman. So go! Stop reading this and read the book instead!Despite the fact that the film is one of my favourites, the book has to be my favourite book of all time and probably will remain so forever. In fact all my friends agree with me and I don't think it matters if you've seen the film first or read the book first, both should appeal to everyone! In fact I recently forced one of my friends to watch it (he's refused twice and said it looked rubbish and girlie) but behold! After about an hour I stopped it, teasing him that I wouldn't force him to watch any more of this rubbish and he looked physical pained. You should have seen the look on his face! He immediately got up and tried to get the remote off me, begging me to put it back on so he could find out what was going to happen to Wesley (I stopped it at a particularly exciting part).It's got something for everyone: there's fencing and giants and evil princes and heroes and (incredibly irritating and stupid) damsels in distress and midget geniuses and a pit of despair (the zoo of death is much better in the book) and miracles and the grandson who comes in with funny one-liners every now and again (eg "Hold it, hold it. What is this? Are you trying to trick me? Where's the sports?(suspiciously) Is this a kissing book?" or my favourite line: "oh, murdered by pirates is good") and revenge and torture and dragons, just kidding, no dragons, but it's got everything else! It's a bit like a fairytale but sooo much better. And it's funny! So you see, anyone from little kids to the elderly, girls and boys alike will enjoy this film. And if you don't then you're just a really strange person.

title: A Family Tradition
content: I can easily say that this is my favorite movie of all time. Back in elementary and middle school I would watch this movie at least twice a month. I knew all the lines by heart before I entered high school and I still know them now that I am in college.If you haven't seen this movie then shame on you. Best movie of its time and of its genre. The wit and humor is timeless and fun to use in every day life. It does happen, I assure you. My whole family loves this movie, including all the guys. I think they like it for the Fire Swamp and Pit of Dispare scenes. You'll get no spoilers from me, just go see it for yourself. I guarantee that you'll love it.

title: One of the most quotable movies ever made.
content: Silly, bad acting, cheesy and somewhat predictable, but definitely one of my favorites.  If you haven't seen it, don't see it with someone who has seen it more than once or you will here it in stereo and not just from the T.V., because they will be reciting it right along with it.

title: I Don't Get What's So Great About It, but Whatever Floats Your Boat...
content: I've heard a lot about this movie, especially praise for it's mix of comedy, romance, and action. Well, they certainly did have all 3, but none of them came off very effectively to me. Most of the jokes didn't work with me, evident by my family laughing as I sat in silence trying to deduce what was so comical about a given line. The action was not too exciting to me, although the coordination on the sword fighting was pretty good. The romance was...arguably absent, to put it gently. I didn't feel any real connection between Westley and Buttercup since they fell in love as soon as we are introduced to them. No build up, no suspense, no nothing. I also found the idea of them being in love totally unbelievable. He did odd jobs around the home and she fell in love with him? Pretty low standards there, Buttercup.Aside from these ineffective aspects, the story also had me emotionally slamming my head against a proverbial wall. I always thought Twilight was the worst offender in the category of having a female lead who is totally bland and male dependent, which hence causes a completely agitating love story to ensue, but Buttercup and her relationship with Westly might just take the cake....OK that's going too far. However, it's still pretty bad, and the story suffers horribly because of it. Most of the movie came off as a way to please adolescent girls who dream of their own prince charming saving them from everything and tending to their every whim and issue. Aside from Buttercup, the characters range from forgettable, to decent, to pretty good. The only character I came to actually like was Inigo, but that isn't saying much given his competition.Overall, I really don't get why this movie is rated so highly, but if people enjoy it, good for them. I'll be avoiding it from now on, however.

title: Makes Tough Men Cry
content: Years ago I watched a tough British Footballer (Soccer Player) being interviewed. He was a soccer pundit at that time but still had a reputation as a bit of a tough guy. But he said his favourite movie was The Princess Bride. So Rodney Marsh - all is forgiven and may all your beautiful daughters love you like I now do (although I am a guy by the way). Memories Eh?I think that this Movie should be the first Movie ever to be awarded a new Award - something like 'Best Loved' or 'Most Charming to all Ages'Perhaps a new IMDb category or search device should show ratings for movies that get the most consistent and regular (good) feedback from users over the long term. This movie is 28 years old and still generates so much post every month - as new people discover its charm.

title: Review #678
content: I don't really think that the movie The Princess Bride needs any more reviews here since there are already 677 and pretty much all of the ones I've skimmed over are very good reviews, but I will still review it anyway because my IMDb personal profile has this thing on it that keeps saying my profile is not complete because I haven't reviewed any movies yet. So OK here is my review of the movie The Princess Bride which is a feature length action adventure fantasy comedy romance flick from the year of our Lord nineteen hundred and eighty-seven..... I believe it was released in the summer of that year in July or perhaps June or maybe August..... The Princess Bride is great.

title: Princess Bride, beyond film fantasy
content: When Carl Reiner created his timeless masterpiece "Princess Bride" the world was blessed. Not only is this film a great story but it is a fantastic mixture of wit and tongue and cheek writing that allows not only children but adults to perch at the edge of their seats and cheer. With a cast of smooth talking Cary Elwes, sweet but strong Robin Wright, loyal sword master Mandy Patinkin and lovably large Andre, the screen is filled to the brim with the best of characters portrayed with great loyalty. There are few movies that will stand up by themselves for ages both as new experiences to new eyes and as cult like classics. Personally, having seen it dozens of times I think my heart has been  taken.. truuuuueee loooooove alas

title: A decidedly okay film
content: I like this movie. I don't think I love it as much as some folks do. It's an agreeable fairy tale with an enjoyably self-aware, slightly cynical sense of humor. When it works, the sword fight between Cary Elwes and Mandy Patinkin for example, it really excels. When it doesn't ... Billy Crystal, some of Andre the Giant's acting ... it just kind of lies there, but never for too long. It sometimes feels to me like the film thinks its' absolutely hilarious, while maybe it's just pretty damn amusing.

title: Just plain fun
content: Something funny with a hint of a story. All the characters are well done, complete with idiosyncracies. The cast is numerous and full. It does not rely on a single funnyman to make the show. It is a great fairytale comedy.

title: Keeps getting better with age!
content: The Princess Bride is by far one of the best movies I've ever seen.  It's an enduring film that everyone I know likes immensely.  This is because this film is not limited to one age group.  When I was a kid I saw it for the first time and loved the action and the romance.  As I grew, I learned to appreciate the exceptional writing and the comedic timing that every player is gifted with.  The lines would be only half as funny if you didn't know how they were delivered.  Every line in this movie is quotable; in fact, in my circle of friends, this is the most quoted movie.  If anyone is reading these comments to see if they would like this movie, I promise you, you will!  Go buy it!  Don't rent it, because you'll end up buying it anyway! :)

title: A total waste of time
content: It's like watching the movie version of a stupid old princess movie...might have been a good one for its own time but seriously don't do it to yourself and don't look at the rating! You've got plenty of better ways to spend (or even waste) your time.

title: A Great Movie for everyone
content: This is such a great movie. I'm 14 I love it my little brother loves and and so do my parents! The characters are hysterical! There's Buttercup girl who lost her love or so she thought. There's Westley her farmboy "As you wish". And of course Prince Humperdinck the snobby stubborn prince everyone loves to hate character. And Inigo Montoya the expert swordsman living only to avenge this fathers murder. Fezzik a giant with a big soft side. And Vizzini the leader of Indigo and Fezzik who thinks he is the smartest of them all. It's a great cast and story. Great movie!

title: By far one of the best movies ever!
content: I first saw this movie on a movie channel and i just fell in love with it. It has unforgettable characters such as Westley(Cary Elwes)who does a perfect job as the hero,as well as help from former enemies Inigo(Mandy Patinkin) and Fezzik (Andre the Giant).The acting is great, the story line is fantastic and unforgettable quotes.(Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya.You killed my father. Prepeae to die!). I also had the pleasure of reading William Goldmans book in my 10th grade english class which was a real treat.I have not a single bad thing to say about The Princess Bride.I'd tell anyone to see this movie in a heartbeat.Definately 5 out of 5 stars!

title: makes it all worthwhile
content: In a world that every day becomes more mired in tragedy, from selfish acts of terror to crippling natural disasters, it becomes increasingly difficult to believe that what I do matters. How can one take any pride in making movies while people offer their lives to help others?Then, once in a while, I read comments like those about this picture. As I run down the list, I see the many ways in which this picture has touched the lives of so many of you, on so many levels. Here is a story that is truly priceless in its timelessness, a movie that really did make a difference, a movie that reaches so broadly that it embraces virtually everyone. A picture that gives so much to its audience.This picture succeeds in taking us away to another place, a place of innocence and nobility, of honour and love; a place that grows ever distant from us. For that, Rob Reiner and William Goldman, thank you. For the last eighteen years of having this picture to escape to, thank you.But most importantly, for restoring my faith in the importance of this business, thank you. I only hope I can contribute to something as meaningful somewhere along the way.

title: Absoloutley Brilliant
content: One day I walked into an A&B Sound and I picked up a movie off the shelf. I turned to my brother and said "hey, buy this(smirking because of the cover). And to my suprise he said "awe, this movie rocks"...Well, we got the movie and I watched it. And watched it and watched. If you watch this movie once, you'll be hooked. You'll never stop laughing, except when you get to the kissing scenes. Even Andre the Giant manages to keep you off your seats.You may be skeptical at first, but once you see it, you'll always, ALWAYS go back for more.

title: Good Movie
content: Awesome movie to watch on a rainy day or any day.The story is great and the characters are good too.A great movie to watch from the beginning until the end.Billy crystal is great as a hero in the story.Has got to be the number 1 fairy tale movie ever made.The chemistry between the grandfather and grandson is great in the movie.The end is great the lovers ride in the sunset together and live happily ever after.The evil prince is one character that is what you want in archenemy to the courageous character of the princess bride's true love.I highly recommend this movie anytime you want to watch a great movie for the whole family.

title: One of the best movies ever made!
content: Quite simply, I think this is one of the best movies ever made.  It has everything: humor, action, romance...  I first saw it as a child, and recently found it at Wal-mart, and promptly bought it.  I've since discovered there's more to it than I realized when I was little.  Everyone should see this movie at least once!

title: A Load of Puke Bile
content: C'mon people, what's the big deal? I have tried and tried to watch and like this movie on recommendations of my so-called friends. But PLEASE... This movie is nothing but a load of boring, contrived, clichéd, CRAP!! No originality whatsoever. AND don't get me started on the acting!!!! This has to be the worst acting I've seen in my life....totally laughable and amateurish to say the least. Let me say it one more time so no one else wastes their valuable time on this pile of putrid crap. The acting was laughable and amateurish, the storyline was old and unoriginal. People, if you want to see a good movie RENT SOMETHING ELSE!!!!

title: An alternative fairy tale
content: Bringing this wonderful and legendary love fairy tale to his grandson by telling stories to his grandson was actually good at the time. The characters inside were quite good for the audience, but the story was really mediocre and there was no bright spot.

title: The feel good, grows on you movie for all generations!
content: Plan to buy this movie or rent it at least twice! My first experience was okay but after the second viewing I was hooked! During the past decade I have shared this movie with dozens of friends and family. We can throw out one of the many great one-liners from the movie and anyone who has seen it will immediately know what you are talking about and add a favorite line of their own! I can't wait to get my hands on the new DVD! Great movie, highly recommended!

title: One of the most beautiful films I´ve ever view
content: No words can explain the feeling of seeing this movie.When you see it you feel like the ill boy (Fred Savage) that is hearing the story, this film has the power to bring us back to our childhood, when we jump in the living room seeing old adventures classics in the Sunday Matinee.The fencing duel is probably the best of all cinema history.

title: TRUUUUE LOVE...
content: Pure genius!  Why do I say that?  Well... is this film making fun of the genre, or is it embracing it?  Both, it seems!Rob Reiner's instant classic film sweeps us away to the story of true love between a fair maiden and her lovingly loyal servant.   An abundance of humour, of thrills, and of "inconcievables" follows.  Goldman's fantastic adapted screenplay (of his own book) gives us laughter, drama, and warms our hearts -- and those of generations to come.

title: A rare treat of swashbuckling Fantasy fun
content: You will almost never see two ambidextrous fencers set to in any film anywhere. And it was pure coincidence that Carey Elwes and Mandy Pitilkin, Roberts and Inigo respectively, were brought together to fence for this movie. It was, according to the director, unknown in advance that either of them were that good, or that they'd have such chemistry that fencing for the fun of it distracted them from filming all through the production.Although it's a low-key Fantasy in terms of magic and monsters, the fairy-tale style carries the story nicely. A dry tongue-in-cheek wit plays all the way through, with a script that's almost entirely classic lines from beginning to end.

title: Simply the best
content: I don't give 10's easily.  In fact, the only other movie that I've ever given a 10 to was "The Empire Strikes Back."  This movie is as funny the 100th time as it is the 1st (maybe funnier) and I never get tired of watching it.  It's simply a masterpiece that may never be duplicated as far as fantasy/comedy goes.

title: This Film Could've Been Better
content: This movie didn't do a thing for me.  It wasn't as good as I thought it was and it was nothing that I expected it to be.  I thought it would have more to it rather than just a simple and innocent fairy tale that you'd see in a child's book of fairy tales.  Plus, I was hoping something would come and turn this movie around and add some spice to it, but it didn't happen, so that was disappointing.  Little kids would probably enjoy this movie, but I didn't enjoy this movie at all.  Big disappointment!!!

title: Best. Ever.
content: The best movie ever.  No movie surpasses this.  I can only hope that there will ever be a movie that is any better than this.  Everything about it is great.  The book is just as good as the movie.  The soundtrack is also pretty nice(there's always a soft spot in my heart for classical guitar music).  Oh, and it somewhat bothers me when people write "Wesley."  It's "Westley" to those of you who don't pay attention.  Uhhh.  Yeh.  And stuff.

title: It's in a kiss
content: A story of true love that harks back to old Hollywood. All the performances are strong, It's not one of those films where one performance stands out and makes you go wow, look what they can do. For me it's about putting a group of actors together who, without fail, compliment each other.Over the years it has gained a somewhat cult status, which is strange for a film of this type, could it be that the story and the deft touches appeal even in this cynical world of ours. That could be it, it shows us a time, abet imaginary, where things are simpler, honour is important and true love is worth fighting for.This film is a joy to watch, every now and then I will return to it, expecting it to have aged. I am never disappointed, it's gentle approach and wit always hook me within the first 15 mins and I'm there to the end waiting for the Grandfathers line. Magic.

title: stays sweet...
content: I first saw this film at a friend's house a few years ago and loved it. When it was on T.V that Christmas I forgot to record it and have been kicking myself ever since.I think the true test of a good film isn't the individual details of acting, direction, screenplay and photography but how you remember it when you haven't seen it for years and can't remember those details anymore.  Well, its quite a while since I saw this film, but every time I think of it I remember how funny and sweet it was and how I never looked at the clock once because I didn't want it to end.

title: A Film that the whole family can enjoy!
content: " My name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, prepare to die!"The Princess Bride Stars Cary Elwes, Mandy Patinkin, Chris Sarandon and Robin Wright as  Buttercup, the Princess Bride. May i say, that this is one heck of a funny and entertaining movie. One of the best from the 80's. Personally, what i think about the Princess Bride is that is one of the funniest movies of all time, and that it has a great story to it. The Princess Bride has also a great adaption to it. This film is great also because it does not take itself to seriously and the fact that the characters are memorable.I give it **** out of ***** stars

title: This movie is timeless
content: This movie is a wonderful mixture of humor, love, sentiment, and duel-to-the-death fighting.  It's a great movie for kids too. And there really aren't any deaths, well, maybe one or two, but they're not really horrifying, and they are justified.It's simply a great story of True love played by two beautiful people and great actors, Cary Elwes and Robin Wright Penn.  Not to mention the supporting actors that really bring a lot of character and joy into the movie.This movie was very nicely scripted and acted.  Well done!  This is a classic love story I will always love.

title: I Don't See Why This Is An All-Time Classic
content: I know that the reputation of "The Princess Bride" is that it is considered to be one of the greatest fairytale stories ever put to film. Besides some understandably iconic characters, however, I just don't quite understand why it is such a classic, as I found it to be rather underwhelming in large portions.For a basic plot summary, "Princess Bride" is a fairytale read to a young boy (Fred Savage) by his grandfather (Peter Falk). The tale focuses on Westley (Cary Elwes) and his quest to find his beloved Buttercup (Robin Wright), now engaged to be wed to Prince Humperdinck (Chris Sarandon). Along the way, Westley meets up with a motley crew of characters that include the giant Fezzik (Andre the Giant), swashbuckling swordsman Inigo Montoya (Mandy Patinkin), and the annoying little imp Vizzini (Wallace Shawn).For the first 20-30 minutes of "Princess Bride", I was engaged and interested. I liked the setup (story being read to a child), the Andre/Patinkin/Shawn interactions are hilarious, and Elwes has just the right sense of humor to pull off his role. There is also just a sense of irreverence that pervades the whole beginning of the film, setting the humorous tone perfectly.After that opening salvo, however, the film seems to trend towards a more conventional "quest" tale, at which point my interest severely waned. Simply put, when the movie turns toward serious plot and away from goofy humor, it completely lost me. There were times where I was even outright bored, as the "meat" of this fairytale isn't anything to write home about. To me, the goofy comedic tone of "Princess Bride" is its calling card, and when most of that was used up in the early goings it fell flat afterwards.Perhaps my view of this film is colored by the fact that I never saw it as a child, but seeing it for the first time as an adult left me wondering why it is considered one of the greats. I'll always remember some of the iconic characters/moments, but taken as a whole "Princess Bride" was mostly underwhelming for me.

title: Brings a smile to my face
content: I can remember sitting at my friends Jess' house when this movie first came out and absolutely loving it.  It appealed to my little girl love for fairy tales, prince and princesses, and knights in shining...well..in tight black pants.  I also loved it for the time period.  Now, watching it I love it for all those reasons and more.  I appreciate the tougue in cheek humor and can enjoy it's silly, almost campy attitude.  I love this movie.  It's just such a simple joy to watch and one can't help but be happy after watching it.

title: Absolutely the BEST Movie ever made!!!!!
content: This is by far the best movie ever for all ages to enjoy.  The Princess Bride has a little bit of everything -- comedy, adventure, romance you name it, it's there.  The story is all about - True Love - and that with it you can survive unspeakable odds and events.  It tells of the love between Westley and Buttercup, the gallant Inigo Montoya on a quest to honor his father, and the obnoxious Prince Humperdincks quest to have Buttercup for his own.  The rapport between the characters is wonderful giving leave to some of the best quotes that you still hear people reciting today!  My favorite line has to be "Ello, my name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, now prepare to die!"  If you have not seen this movie, please rent it and then see if you don't fall in love with it too.

title: Nothing to add...
content: I can't possibly add to the list of accolades for this marvelously funny movie, except to add one of my favorite tag lines:"Oh, you mean this key!"

title: A timeless, funny, action-filled love story!!
content: "The Princess Bride" is a fun ride that audiences will enjoy. When you mix pirates, sword wielding Spaniards, good-natured giants, evil masterminds, six-fingered counts, and the Cliffs of Insanity, what do you get? An adventurous, fun-filled, action-packed movie that will have you laughing, crying, cheering, and counting your fingers! The story opens to find a young princess, Buttercup (Robin Wright) and her servant, a quiet, well-mannered Westly (Carey Elwes). As they fall in love, Westly decides he must leave Buttercup to pursue his fortune so he may provide a life for her. Westly leaves and is not heard from again, thought to be killed at the hands of the Dread Pirate Roberts. Buttercup, broken-hearted, is then betrothed to a Prince Humperdink (Chris Sarandon) who is not as kind as Westly.At this point, the movie becomes a witty, dialogue-driven, action flick. Buttercup is kidnapped by an evil mastermind (Wallace Shawn) and his henchmen; a Spaniard (Mandy Patinkin) bent on the revenge of his murdered father, and a giant (Andre the Giant) who just wants to do things right. Chasing the kidnappers is Buttercup's fiancé, Humperdink, and the shadowy figure in black, the Dread Pirate Roberts.Not all are who they seem to be as the characters interact. The action continues as the settings change quite rapidly throughout the movie, as does the pace. This tends to keep the viewer reminded of the original theme of the movie, which is the love story. And even though it is of the age old plot to rescue the beautiful princess from the mean old bad guy, the entertainment value of the film is well worth it. Movie goers that may have seen the film "Willow" can relate to the type of plot, settings, and characters here.Though the comic lines and sometimes even silly dialogue might suggest this film is aimed at children, the action sequences might suggest otherwise. A few scenes display violence and blood, contemplation of suicide, and big, scary rodents.Another positive for this film is that it is timeless. It should never grow old and out of date as it has a medieval setting, including castles, villages, horses, torches, and swordplay. It is a great story that any one, at any age, can relate to because it appeals to the hero in all of us. Viewers will love the characters, the action, the love, and will find themselves rooting for the good guys.or are they the bad guys?

title: Hello, my name is Inigo . . . what more should one say!?
content: WOW, what a movie. One of the best movies ever made in the comedy genere. Brilliant acting and a brilliant script with even more brilliant humour. A movie you can watch again and again and never become bored with it. After even the first time of watching The Princess Bride you can't help but repeat all the wonderfully fabulous catch phrases. A fairy tale told in a superb fashion using todays newest mode of storytelling. Rarely a weak moment. Pure enjoyment and laughter almost guaranteed. It's highly improbable that you won't like this film if you like to laugh and allow yourself to be the child you know you are!

title: okay story but poor production
content: 'The Princess Bride' is a fantasy film about a man who goes to rescue a kidnapped princess that he has fallen in love with. The main problem that I had with this film is the production; the monsters and fights did not look realistic, and the romance was silly and awkward in places. The production of this film could have been much better. As a story, I think that the film succeeded. The way that it was presented as a tale from the grandfather to the boy also put it into perspective, but the production made it seem like an unprofessional film, and I did have trouble taking it seriously. As this film is generally well-liked by a wide audience, I would recommend it. Just try to not let the production put you off.

title: The greatest ever!!!!
content: There is no doubt that this movie is the greatest ever made.  It is a timeless story with fantastic acting and characters that find a place in your heart.  There are lines in this movie that I find myself using in everyday speech because they just fit.  Modern movie goers are just unphased by good films, and it is next to never that an audience will applaud at the close of a film. But when Wesley told Humperdinck to "drop your sword" the theatre I was in literally erupted with applause and cheering.  If you've seen it, you know what I mean.  If you haven't, all I can say is that's "totally, completely, and in all other ways inconceivable!"

title: great movie for everyone
content: I've seen this movie I don't know how many times and it's still good! It really has everything: cute enough for kids and still good for adults with a good story and lots of action. I even bought the book, even if it's not as good as the movie! I think it should become a classical! The only downside may be that it's a bit too "romantic" but it's well-balanced with the down to earth remarks of the characters.

title: Classic. Hilarious. Perfect.
content: This movie was so perfect. Funny, but willing to make fun of itself. Romantic but not sappy. Perfectly timed, well acted, well written. Everyone I know loved it. Half the people I know spew quotes from it from time to time. What more could you want?

title: I've Finally Seen This 80's Classic...
content: THE PRINCESS BRIDE is one of those movies that is almost pointless to comment on because pretty much everyone has seen it, and everyone has their opinion. And yet here I am. I'd managed to go a long time without ever actually having seen the film, though I was familiar with some of it's more popular moments from their repetition and spoofing in pop culture. I also read the script as part of an assignment in college for a creative writing course but, at the time, didn't find anything particularly special about it. It just read like any other fairy tale film with some moments of appreciable comedy scattered throughout. When a friend of mine found out I hadn't seen the movie and gave me a confounded stare, I figured it was time. So finally, last year at the age of 31, I sat down to watch THE PRINCESS BRIDE andit was good. I enjoyed it. My daughter seemed to enjoy it. But neither of us had the reaction that most others seem to have in regards to Rob Reiner's 1987 fantasy/comedy. Since then, I've watched it a few more times and I'll admit it's grown on me more with each subsequent viewing. I've developed some respect for the film and I understand why it seems to have developed such a cult following. It sticks with you. I didn't think much of it when I first watched it, but now I can't go a day without mentally or verbally making reference to it.The story is your average fairy tale: young lovers are separated, the man is thought dead and the woman is forced into a marriage engagement with a corrupt prince. The price plans to use the woman in a plot to start a war with a neighboring kingdom, and the young man returns in disguise to rescue her. Et cetera, et cetera, and they live happily ever after. But the characters themselves are just so much fun. Reiner's casting in the film is absolutely perfect. Cary Elwes and Robin Wright are the epitome of fairy tale lovers: young and beautiful, with real chemistry. And Elwes is fantastically dashing as the swashbuckling hero. As good as the two of them are, I would've much preferred an entire movie about the trio of mercenaries who kidnap Buttercup (Wright) on orders from the prince and jumpstart the plot. Vizzini (Wallace Shawn), Fezzik (André the Giant), and Inigo Montoya (Mandy Patinkin) drive the first half of the film as the mysterious "Man in Black" pursues them to retrieve our damsel in distress. I loved these guys and the first half of the movie was, in my opinion, where all the best material lies. Once it all shifts to our hero versus the corrupt Prince Humperdinck (Chris Sarandon), my interest wanes a bit. There's still some good material there but it loses a lot of the fun, fantastical parody elementsthe Cliffs of Insanity, the Fire Swamp with the R.O.U.Sthat kept me laughing along.Despite it's minor flaws, THE PRINCESS BRIDE is undeniably a classic. It's infinitely quotable. It hits all the right buttons for a good comedy or adventure or fantasy film. And it's populated with an incredible cast. I love the 80's reliance on practical effects, from a time before CG became popular and turned everything into high-tech cartoons. The R.O.U.S. would never have been as fun a sequence if it weren't puppetry and people in suits. As fantastic as Elwes was in the hero's role, Inigo Montoya is easily my (and certainly many other's) favorite character with Fezzik in a close second. André the Giant made for the perfect simple giant with a heart of gold. His speech can be hard to understand at times, but subtitles made sure I wouldn't miss out on some of his classic lines. Chances are anyone reading this comment have already seen this movie and aren't looking to be convinced whether to watch it or not, so I'm not here to promote the film. I'm just here to admit I was mistaken in blowing off this movie for so long and I can now be counted among the myriad of PRINCESS BRIDE fans. I don't know that I'm much of a die-hard fan but it's got my massive respect for what it is and what it's become. Without a doubt, I'm sure I'll find myself quoting the film and I'll be more apt to stop and watch it when I stumble across it on television.

title: Why did it take me so long to watch this
content: After watching the complete Columbo series back to back, I thought I'd go back and finally watch this as I'd become addicted to Peter Falk.The movies is brilliant from the story to the one liners and gags that came through some subtle and others requiring the knowledge of the actors other work.Each character brilliantly portrayed, if a Terry Pratchett movie was to be done with justice to his writing, this would be it. Mel Brooks and Rob Reiner are the king's of Hollywood humour with Thier satire, I will be looking through more off Rob's work. So from a Google tv rental, a most entertaining night was had with lol moments, romance and a warm feeling in the heart at the end.

title: One of the most Brilliant Films ever made...
content: I first saw this movie when it premiered in the theatres in 1987. My mother took me to see when I was a child, and we both loved it. Many years passed, and while I remembered it, years went by before I saw it again. Some years ago back in high school, friends and I were discussing it and we all reminisced about how much we had enjoyed it as kids. So, we decided we had to see it again and dashed out to rent it. What a surprise! It was like seeing it for the first time again, only this time it was even better! It was so amazing and so hysterically funny that we had tears in our eyes from laughing so hard. From that day on, it was added to my 'favourite films' list and every year that passes I love it more. I own it on VHS, DVD, and now wonderfully on the brand new Special Edition DVD. Out of all the various films I own on VHS and DVD, The Princess Bride is the only film I own three copies of. Now, THAT's dedication! ;-) I have to say the regular DVD edition from last year was sadly disappointing. It only has a chapter search, original theatrical trailer, and the film on it. So, if you haven't purchased this film on DVD yet, I highly recommend the Special Edition version which arrived September 4, 2001. It is exactly what I have always wished for, full feature commentary, actor interviews, "making of" featurettes, etc.This film is an amazing classic, a film I feel that is generally enjoyed even more by adults than children. That is certainly the case for my own generation that remembers it from childhood as well as adulthood. With it's satirical comedy, witty romance, and high adventure, for me this film ranks high with other classics such as Breakfast at Tiffany's, Rear Window, and Notting Hill, which are some of my other favourites. Not to mention some of the most spectacular scenery. For many years after so many viewings I thought that the Cliffs of Insanity scenes were filmed on the Cliffs of Moher in Ireland. I am happy to report that with the Special Edition DVD this confirms my belief as correct! I realize that some scenes were shot on a set, but mostly they really did film it on the Cliffs of Moher. I have been to the Cliffs of Moher, and they are even more breathtaking in person than on film. For anyone who hasn't been there, the Cliffs of Moher (pronounced "More") are 700 ft cliffs that drop off sharply into the Atlantic ocean off of the coast of County Clare in the West coast of Ireland. Ireland is one of the most beautiful countries in the world and the wonderful scenery this country provides really adds to the ambiance of the film.Anyone who enjoyed this movie should definitely read the book this film is based on. It's a wonderful book and seeing the differences between William Goldman's book and his screenplay is fascinating.

title: okay type movie
content: i have already read the many reviews of other users about the greatness of that movie.but when i watched i found it strictly okay.its not more than average movie.heroine of the movie is good looking lady.she has good screen presence too. scenes with child and his grandpa are the high points of this movie. movie also shows some great scenery .but the power and depth of a story which is the base of every good film is missing here. its more for children.the giant played his part well.but he has hardly any lines to speak.fighting scenes are strictly okay.they could have been much more interesting and better. because of the restriction of IMDb i wrote it that lengthy.because they don't publish it until it contain 10 lines at-lest.

title: Better than a bottle of aspirin.
content: I was sitting at home in a snowstorm with a fever, chills and a bit of nausea. Time to watch a movie - but which movie? I spied my copy of the Princess Bride I bought after getting my DVD a few months ago. The last time I saw this was several years ago on VHS at a friend's in monophonic. What a spectacular experience on my new Sony Trinitron with a good stereo sound system! The nuances of color are wonderful and the sound track impeccable.I have seen this movie several times over the years, and enjoy it just as much each time. How many movies can you say that of? Still, you don't want to wear it out. My suggestion is every home should have a copy of The Princess Bride, but save it for when someone is sick, just like the book in the movie. It sure made me feel better, even though I am a grown up.Rob Reiner and the rest of the crew deserve a lot of credit for this movie. It is one of those gems where everything seems to fall into place perfectly. Thank you!Evidently there is at least one cynic out there, though, who was not touched by this gentle fairy tale, which is ironic considering one of the greatest cynics of all worked on this movie: Norman Lear, creator of All in the Family. I agree with "markwilson" about Titanic; if I had to watch that when I was sick, I would probably shoot myself. All I can say, Mr. MW, is if The Princess Bride doesn't cheer you up, next time you get sick, make sure you have a big bottle of aspirin, and drink plenty of tequila.

title: Rob Reiner's masterpiece.
content: Perfect in every detail.  Especially wonderful performances by Mandy Pantinkin, Andre the Giant, Billy Crystal, Carol Kane.  Every frame is a picture postcard.  Something for everyone: Action, Comedy, Romance, Horror, Drama.  Endlessly entertaining.

title: The Best
content: Of course the sword fight is the best in movie history - witty as well as exciting. Princess Bride is one of those films that reminds you just how wonderful the movies can be. Why isn't it always like this? I could watch it again and again.

title: Delightful, funny, adventurous movie
content: No spoilers here.... If you like a movie with likeable characters, a fun plot, romantic adventure, and lots of witty dialogue, this movie is for you.I saw it over ten years ago, and it still has remained my favorite movie. It's a timeless, wonderful classic made for the screen by William Goldman's original story.  If you like the movie, the book by Goldman is even better. :)

title: A tale of romance, death, pirates, kings, queens and so much more!
content: This has to be one of the best movies i have ever seen!  Cary Elwes was the perfect Westley, he is what i thought of while reading the book.  Never have i found a movie/novel that could make me laugh cry and hope for mircles like this one did!  I truly stand that everyone should see this movie!  If possible check out the DVD with great interviews with Cary and the rest of the cast.  Including William himself!  This is a must have movie in ever collection!

title: Silly,but still good
content: October 2018: Enjoyed it. A little bit silly but great for a Friday evening

title: This movie aged really bad
content: My little sister 5 years old loved the movie. But I don't understand the high score here. The story is awful, silly, basic. Almost fell sleep a couple of times. Would not recommend to any adult.If this movie were released today with the same script, story, jokes you can be sure it would be trash.This movie was viewed by a lot of people that was born before the 90' , so I understand they adore a movie they saw as a child. But if you see this movie as adult is just really bad, boring and the special effects aged really, really bad. Hope they don't ever make a remake of this movie. At least the main actress got to prove she is a great actress in other roles.

title: A timeless Fairytale
content: The Princess Bride is a movie that I saw when I was young and fell in love with it. 10 years later and it's still one of my favorite movies. It's a movie that I will always love and plan to show to my future children. It's a wonderful fairytale.

title: a good fantasy movie
content: The acting in this movie is great. It also has a great story line. It also has great special effects. This movie is must see. A young is kidnapped and her child hood friend is out to save her. This movie is scarier at times. It is a very good fantasy movie. It has a few monsters in it. This movie is must see. They is some hummer in it. It is a very good movie. I need more lines and I am running out things to say. Great movie great movie great movie great movie. It has a lot of action. It is not as good as the middle earth movies. But it is good. It hard to be has good as the middle earth movie because there are great movies. Is this spam I would not want to ruin your community

title: My only real problem with this movie ...
content: ... is that it is billed first and foremost as a children's movie.  I just purchased the movie and it comes in a children's clamshell cover and begins with previews of video tapes that might appeal to a two year old.Ok, it _is_ in fact, a fairy tale.  I buy that.  But the ending contains a sword fight which makes one as squirmish as anything in the movie Scream!  And the dialog is some of the wittiest I've heard from any movie, children's or not.  In fact, minus the bathroom humor, the Naked Gun series is much more child-oriented (and certainly more childish) than The Princess Bride.So what is The Princess Bride?  It's a witty, funny, entertaining fairy tale spoof, which never takes itself too seriously.  As most reviewers before me have already pointed out, the movie contains an over-abundance of quotable lines.  Unless you're almost dead, or all dead, you can't help but enjoy the dialog.What makes this film refreshing is that it's a true spoof of the fairy-tale genre, and succeeds as well or better as Airplane succeeds as being a spoof of hero movies, or as Scream succeeds as being a spoof of horror movies, or as Naked Gun (aka Police Squad) succeeds as being a spoof of police detective flicks.Some more quick points:  1) I don't know if you'll ever see a Cary Elwes performance as good as this. 2) The scenery is magnificent.  3) Robin Wright is a sight for sore eyes. 4) I think we're really due for a Princess Bride II.Oh know, I'm rhyming!Westley: You mean you wish to surrender to me? Very well, I accept...

title: An Enchanting Love Story December 22, 2004
content: The Princess Bride is one of the best films of 1987 Robin Wright Penn gave an amazing performance as Buttercup a girl who fell in love with her farm boy Wesley (Elwes). When she receives word that he was murdered her heart is broken and vows she won't ever love again , but five years later her beloved Wesley returns just in time to rescue her from marrying an evil prince but not without the help of an unlikely bunch of characters. The chemistry between Cary Elwes and Robin Wright Penn is quite remarkable they help to bring the two main characters from the book to life in this wonderful movie. I recommend this film to anyone who enjoys adventure or doubts true love I give it 10 out 10 , my favorite character is Wesley he never gave up on Buttercup or doubted true love.

title: The Princess Bride was indeed a priceless classic
content: Wow. I must say, Rob Reiner did it again. What an entertaining, fun movie. I did not realize that it was Robin Wright's first major film. No wonder everyone fell in love with her. Her facial expressions were priceless. I would have to say, however that Mandy Patinkin stole the show. His acting skills are so brilliant. I believe he could portray any role however its difficulty. Also, I love it when he says, "Hello, my name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die." I dedicate this comment to "Andre the Giant" whom I loved as a kid growing up. I watched his "fake" wrestling matches with my friends, and we always were very supportive of him. I thought it was great that he got to make a film with such good actors. "The Princess Bride" is a timeless piece and has its humor as well as its intense moments. Now that's pure genius. Thank you to the writer of this great film. It will be a classic like "The Wizard of Oz", "Oliver" and "The Sound of Music," the musicals. Also, who can resist Cary Elwes? How easily he made his character come to life. He portrayed his character effortlessly. (You really went from bad to good, Sean Penn, when you left Madonna for Robin. Well done! She's a true beauty. Well, sorry, I did not realize that they are now divorced too.) Christopher Guest and Chris Sarandon were excellent as well. The casting was perfect...absolutely perfect. It's hard to believe it's a 20 year old film....lol.

title: One of the greatest film fairy tales.
content: One of my top movies ever. A children's story told so adults will enjoy it as much as the children. Full of wit, clever, self referential, at one level, but a simple tale well told at another. It's all in the screenplay and the acting as well, not in big budgets or special effects. Why don't they make more films like this?

title: Beautiful yet scandalous
content: Ancient formulas creatively mix with new elements.  In particular, the humor is wonderfully tasteful.  Overall, this is a darn good movie; I could go on for hours about it.Unfortunately, it's tainted with a some rather disturbing elements.  The movie closes out with a tasteless 80's-style love song.  (Viewers of "The Hobbit" know that adopting music popular to an era is the surest way to kill a classic soundtrack.)  Also, the sexism is disturbing.  Buttercup, complete with the cheesy name, can be forgiven as the typical "bait chick".  After all, as bait chicks go, she does have a few redeeming qualities and some individuality.  However, even with her excluded and the time period considered, the cast is disturbingly male-dominated.These offenses are not coincidental and hence inexcusable, but they shouldn't deter anyone from enjoying the film.  It's just worth lamenting that this movie, as good as it is, could have been so much more.

title: Clever, refreshing and witty!
content: The whole story line of The Princess Bride is great. The concept is refreshing and cleverly original. The script is witty and well delivered by the actors, who are all very convincing in their roles. This is probably one of Cary Elwes' best roles as well as one of Mandy Patinkin's best. Of course, who can resist the incomparable Billy Crystal and Carol Kane together.. "Have fun storming the castle!" ? They were so funny. See it, you'll enjoy it; and you will laugh like you haven't laughed in a long while.

title: humorous
content: The sharp script is full of humorous dialogue, and the performance of the individual actor's hard work is also very happy

title: truly one of the best
content: this is truly one of the best movies of all time in my opinion. it kept you laughing to the point of tears and wondering what could happen next to make the movie any better. on a scale of 1 to 10 this movie is a 10 all the way. up there with "Robin Hood Men in Tights"

title: One is never too young for such a masterpiece
content: Yes, this movie (1987) is older than me (2001) and yes, this is perhaps the first time ever in my life have I been so in love with such a movie.In a nutshell: a whimsical fairytale with some extra bits and bobs here and there, a great show for all ages to enjoy.The title gives off heavy fairytale vibes and it definitely is one, but at the same time it isn't your typical fairytale. It contains the typical elements of a fairytale - the prince, the princess, a kingdom etc but with a different plot and a different way in how things are laid out.Of all the movies of I have seen, this is by far the most quotable one. It is loaded with quotes, most of them for bringing laughs but every now and then some wisdom pops up. For meme people: most quotes in this movie are meme-able.
