I've seen them everywhere.I almost never rewatch movies since I did not felt the need, but I've been on The Princess Bride over and over again to the point I can recall the plot and most of the lines in my head. A solid 10/10 from me, definitely would recommend.

title: Possibly the most contemporary fairy tale that has already become a classic.
content: Rob Reiner brings William Goldman's timeless story to life on the big screen, capturing and enhancing all its magic. Generations of parents who grew up watching this film have since shared it with their children, much like past generations shared the Grimms' Fairy Tales, adding it to the ever-expanding list of society's shared stories.One of its biggest strengths is the fantastic cast, with some of the best-cast characters ever, particularly André René Roussimoff as Fezzik who makes the character truly appear as a real giant. The relationship between the Cary Elwes and Robin Wright characters, Westley and Buttercup, is the emotional center of the film and has the power to win over even the biggest skeptics of romance.

title: Cute
content: Fun movie. Light. Made me laugh even 30 years later. Happy I saw it.

title: If I was stuck in a medieval love story, this would be the one
content: Witty, delightful, colorful, astounding, and endearing. For anyone who does not like this film, its clear you have nothing else to look forward to in life. Even after 15 years, I have yet to find a film that even closely resembles this classic. That's why it will have such staying power, a presence which one will remember and pass it on for others to see. The film was well cast, from Wallace Shawn to Billy Crystal, all the way down to Mandy Patinkin, Christopher Guest and Andre the Giant. Sadly, Cary Elwes proved to be his own demon by starring in some fairly horrid films after this feature, forever placing himself in the annals of B-stardom. Hopefully, this film does not fall into the doldrums of anonymity. If you haven't seen this film, go out and get the DVD. You won't regret it!

title: True Family Entertainment!
content: What can I say about this film? It is one of my all time favourites that has a truly superb cast mixing well know and established actors (Billy Crystal, Peter Cooke, Peter Falk) with at the time unknowns (Carey Elwes, Robin Wright). I watched this many times as a kid not appreciating various aspects but watching it now I realise how corny it is in places and that only adds to the films excellence, this film could not have been totally serious with Billy Crystal as Miracle Max and Peter Cooke as the impressive Clergy Man. This is one the whole family can enjoy, either together or alone. Every so often a true Gem of a film comes along and this was one. If you have the misfortune not to have seen this film then I highly recommend it, if you have already seen it, I'm sure you love it and I urge you to watch it again.

title: Magical
content: I first saw this film as a teenage girl and was instantly enchanted. Occasionally, things just GEL -writing, direction, music, casting- in a way that words cannot really describe. This was one of those movies.Goldman does a brilliant job of giving us a satirical fairy-tale that is not so heavy on "satire" that is steals the enchantment and romance. The swordfighting scenes are probably among the best that have ever been captured on film. The romance is beautiful (between two beautiful people; Mr. Elwes and Ms. Wright (now Wright-Penn) are, as director Rob Reiner describes them in his commentary, "two of the better-looking people on the planet"). And, leaving aside our maturity and independence, what woman was not once a girl who daydreamed about falling in love with and being saved by a dashing hero and being given a kiss like the ones shared by our couple in this film? There are classics "for their time", and there are classics of all-time; this belongs in the all-time category.

title: A Great Flick
content: Once when I was in the Navy, I was on an extended deployment where we spent over 70 days at sea.  About 8 of us would watch a movie every evening--since we had over 200 titles on board we had an unofficial rule that we would never watch the same movie twice in a given 70 day patrol.  We also were 8 guys with several distinctly different tastes in movies so we took turns either picking the movie or enduring another's choice.  The night we first watched PRINCESS BRIDE, it was remarkable how each and every one of us had really loved that movie.  It was the ONLY movie that ever violated the once per patrol rule--we saw it once a week and enjoyed it more each time we saw it.

title: I wanted to give this film an 11!
content: This is my all time favourite movie.I first saw this as a 14 year old, and it has just been getting better and better with each viewing. Every time I see it, I find more that I missed the previous time.I would really like to see the sequel made - the story is told in the 15th anniversary book.

title: Inconceivable!
content: Inconceivable! Funny ass movie, never gets old! 150% ClassicA mix of comedy, drama, action and adventure all wrapped into one movie.There are some corny scenes, but those will no doubt fly right over the heads of young viewers :PThen again... It was made in the 80s and they did not have the CGI back then that we have today.This movie is good in all the right places... it's a shame there are not more like it these days.If you liked this one I would suggest you try Robinhood Men In Tights played by the same lead actor.

title: Another risky review but here we go.
content: I hate to diss a beloved classic and I'm probably going to get hate for it but I really don't get it. I've never seen it as a kid so nostalgia is not helping. Since this is such a classic among my fellow nerds, highly praised and often quoted I thought it was time I watched it. But honestly I was bored halfway through and almost stopped right there and then. I could see the youngest kids maybe liking it (I could see not liking it when I was a kid, the same way I never really liked The Goonies). But a lot of kid movies these days have enough to keep adults interested as well. This just feels old, campy without the charm, clumsy, not really funny, and overall just ridiculous.

title: All time classic
content: Among my favorite movies. This has it all - action, romance, and comedy rolled into one masterfully woven package. All of the performances are exceptional and this certainly ranks among the few movies in the last 30 years that is perfectly cast. It has the feel of a spoof, which is no surprise with Rob Reiner at the helm. Yet at the same time it is very genuine and sincere.No other picture for me has such a plethora of infinitely quotable lines, and I still use many of them to this day. They always bring a smile to my face.I don't have anything negative to say about the Princess Bride - it has a wide appeal and with good reason. Enjoy with my warmest recommendations.

title: Top 5 Movie of All-time
content: One of the film's greatest strengths is its ensemble cast, each member bringing their characters to life with unforgettable performances. Mandy Patinkin as Inigo Montoya, the vengeful swordsman on a quest to avenge his father's death, delivers some of the film's most iconic lines, particularly the famous, "Hello, my name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die." Patinkin's portrayal of Inigo is both intense and endearing, making him one of the most memorable characters in the film. Similarly, Wallace Shawn's portrayal of Vizzini, the self-proclaimed genius who constantly declares everything "inconceivable," provides much of the film's comedic flair. Shawn's comedic timing is impeccable, and his scenes with Elwes and Patinkin are among the film's highlights. Andre the Giant, as the gentle giant Fezzik, rounds out the trio of lovable rogues who aid Westley in his quest. Despite his intimidating size, Andre brings a warmth and charm to Fezzik that makes him impossible not to love. Chris Sarandon's Prince Humperdinck and Christopher Guest's Count Rugen are equally effective as the film's villains. Humperdinck is both cowardly and conniving, while Rugen is cold and calculating, particularly in his scenes with Inigo Montoya. Together, they create a formidable opposition to Westley and his allies, adding tension and drama to the otherwise lighthearted narrative. Beyond its stellar cast, The Princess Bride excels in its script, written by William Goldman, who also authored the original novel. Goldman's screenplay is a masterclass in blending humor with heart, crafting dialogue that is both sharp and timeless. The film's wit and humor are laced with a subtle irony that allows it to poke fun at the traditional tropes of fairy tales, while still embracing them. Lines like, "As you wish," and, "Have fun storming the castle!" have become iconic in popular culture, a testament to the film's enduring appeal. The film's visuals and production design also contribute to its fairy tale atmosphere. The scenic landscapes, from the Cliffs of Insanity to the Fire Swamp, provide a fantastical backdrop for the story's events. While the special effects may not be as advanced as those in modern films, they possess a charm and practicality that lend authenticity to the film's world. Coupled with Mark Knopfler's enchanting score, the movie's aesthetic perfectly complements its narrative. One of the most remarkable aspects of The Princess Bride is its ability to appeal to a wide range of audiences. Children can enjoy the adventure, the humor, and the fantastical elements, while adults can appreciate the film's wit, the romance, and the deeper themes of loyalty, revenge, and true love. The movie never takes itself too seriously, which allows it to balance its moments of humor and drama seamlessly. In conclusion, The Princess Bride is a perfect 10 out of 10. It stands as a testament to the power of storytelling, bringing together an exceptional cast, a sharp and witty script, and a timeless love story. The film's charm lies in its ability to transcend generations, offering something for everyone. Whether you're watching it for the first time or the fiftieth, The Princess Bride never fails to entertain, enchant, and inspire. It's a film that reminds us of the magic of cinema and the enduring power of love and adventure.

title: One of the most entertainig movies ever made. For the whole family
content: I just wanted to say that this is one of my favorite movies. The grandiosity of this movie is in the story. It is a sweet and beautiful story, and it plays in favor of the own movie. The magic is that you will love it as a child, adult or any age and any moment in your life.

title: Pure magic
content: My all-time favourite film. Not necessarily the best-directed, or acted, or the best cinematography, but for sheer inventive hilarity and a sense of adventure, this is unbeatable. It's impossible not to become totally involved in the plot, which sweeps you along with its infectious, gleeful wit. They simply don't come as good as this. Go out and find a copy right now.

title: Hilarious
content: The writing is comedic genius, the cast is perfect.  I rarely buy videos, but I bought this one because I got tired of renting it.  It's funny everytime I watch it!  Rob Reiner's direction reminds me of some of Mel Brook's work--that's a good thing.

title: Almost fell asleep
content: Watched this because of the raving reviews, and also because the torture machine scared me so much as an 8 year old that I turned off the movie, so I wanted to check how scary it really is.Ok so the torture scenes are not so scary now. I also admit that the movie does have its moments, and that some lines are funny and quotable.Overall though, I didn't enjoy it. The story is bland, the different parts seem rather disconnected, and the characters don't experience any growth and therefore feel flat and lifeless.What does this movie want to be? Epic, funny, quirky, scary? It did feel like a fairly random hodge-podge to me. As I'm writing this, I am reminded of the corncob scene in Troll 2. It's awkward, a little bid fascinating, and totally out of place. And my next thought is that Troll 2 is actually the better movie. It didn't take itself seriously at all, and I've found it to be entertaining, which unfortunately I cannot say about The Princess Bride.There, I compared TPB, one of the web's most beloved movies, with Troll 2, which a lot of people love to call out as the worst movie ever, and the latter came out on top.If you really want to watch this one, I'd suggest putting it on as a background movie while you're busy with something else.

title: This is a film directed by a childlike director
content: This is a funny movie, originally a childish fairy tale, but because of some childishness, the color of the joke has become cold, and the ridicule and cuteness that can be seen everywhere can't help but endure.The music inside is especially worth mentioning, it is very interesting, it adds a lot of color to the movie, you listen to music, you know the situation and urgency, the protagonist is impatient, etc.

title: awesome
content: I could watch this movie a thousand times and not get sick of it! By the way the story-line goes, doesn't leave you at the edge of your seat but laid back and laughing.  Everyone can watch it!  It's a classic tale of two love birds with a whole lot of comedy.

title: Romance and High adventure
content: It is inconceivable how they could make such a good movie. This is one of those movies that the story is being told and periodically you are drawn back to the reader and listener to see what they think of the story.The reader is a grandfather played by Peter Falk and the grandson that is listening to the bedtime story is Fred Savage. Of course we are listening also.Watch the expressions on Prince Humperdinck's (Chris Sarandon) face as he gets foiled again. Exceptional good story and actors. Lots of mush and unexpected trials.See Peter Falk again with Cyndi Lauper in....Vibes (1988).

title: Inconceivably good fun!
content: I have a fond spot for this movie. Its gentle humour and simple values (and perhaps offputting title) combine to make a movie that just keeps going and going.If you asked any person in the street to tell you what sort of film might star the diverse talents of Peter Falk, Fred Savage, Cary Elwes, Mandy Patinkin, Andre the Giant, Billy Crystal and Peter Cook, they might have a hard time coming up with an answer. I can't think of a more varied cast for any film.If a film leaves you muttering some line of dialogue for days, or even weeks after you've watched it, then you know it must be pretty good. But when a film drags that same line out of you year after year after year, then you know it must be something special. You too will look incredulous when something goes wrong in your life and the word "Inconceivable!" will spring unbidden to your lips. Trust me, it happens.Princess Bride is an action comedy that must be seen to be believed. There are no flashy special effects, no CGI. Just simple, honest comedy and action.Strongly recommended.

title: Best film you never saw....
content: What I love most about this film, (other than the obvious), is it's appeal to anyone anywhere. You can speak to someone you have never met, from the other side of the planet, and within five minutes, be quoting this film.Personally I think they should re-release it... but thats just me.

title: The Best Movie of All Time
content: These comments may not be unique, but "The Princess Bride" is the best movie of all time.  I find it hard to believe that people actually don't like it.  The classic lines in the movie have had people quoting it over and over for the past 15 years.  The humor in it is one of a kind.  Not since "Monty Python and the Holy Grail" has a movie been so quoted.  All the acting by previously unknown actors is superb, considering the budget the movie had.  "The Princess Bride"  is a movie many people missed in the theaters. See it now, or see it again, and you'll see how good of a movie it is for people of all ages.

title: Don't buy the hype
content: Can't believe the inflated reviews. A few moments of humor but otherwise shallow and silly. Frame narrative with grandfather and grandson is the best part of it. So many other great movies out there.

title: I Truly Love This Movie!!!!!!
content: As a 40-something guy who's been labeled "16 with a fake ID and a bad attitude," this film has its own apartment in my heart.Every archetype that exists seems to be here, and it is the type of film that, somehow, always seems to have existed.This lovely piece of work has brought me through so many dark times, that it is a part of my family.Peter Beagle once said in reference to Tolkien's "Lord Of The Rings" that he envied anyone who had never read it, for they are in for a delight.If you have not seen this film, I envy you, for you are in for the treat of your life.

title: great
content: What a great movie.  One of the truly great films of all time.  It has everything anyone of all ages could want.  It also has the best sword fight in the history of movies.  If you havent seen it yet, then you're really missing out on a great experience.

title: My Favorite Movie Ever!
content: This is by and far my favorite movie. Corny? In places. Serious? In places. It is a wonderful mixture of farce and fantasy. I have it on VHS and when DVD came out on that. The book was recently re-released for a 25-year anniversary edition (it has the first chapter from the sequel).The odd thing about this movie to me is -- Many movies adapted from book often leave viewers saying, "They did this part better in the movie, but the book was much better." With this movie I find myself saying, "They did some parts better in the book, but the movie was much better."

title: One of my all time favorite movies
content: A great movie for the kid in all. Action, adventure, romance, comedy, Good verse Evil, and lots of sword fighting. Maybe a little too much action for the very young but plays well even after seeing it over 5 times.

title: Wow
content: This movie is great.  The subtle humor is lost on some, primarily the people who hate the movie.  Everything from the sword fight between the man in black and inigo to the "impressive clergyman" to the four white horses is great.  I give 10 out of 10...if you dont like it, watch a little more closely and get the jokes.

title: Action, Romance, Comedy all rolled into one
content: I consider The Princess Bride my favorite movie of all times. I don't plan on telling anything about the plot; Let me just say it has the catchiest dialogue ever. You'll probably find yourself quoting lines like "My name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, prepare to die!" well after the film is over. Smart, witty, funny, full of twists and surprises - a guaranteed enjoyment.

title: A funny, adventuresome and romantic movie!
content: I enjoy this movie very much, and I think most people would if they watched it!  There are a few objectionable things, but over all I think it is good. There are lots of funny lines that our family has memorized and that we repeat once in a while.

title: One of the Best of the 80's
content: The Princess Bride is a near-perfect fantasy/adventure/comedy, and one of the best films that the 1980's have to offer.  Based on a hilarious book by S. Morgenstern and scripted by William Goldman, Rob Reiner showcased a deft touch for directing material which required just the right tone to work. The casting made the film, IMHO.  Cary Elwes was a dashing Wesley, Robin Wright a beautiful Buttercup, Andre the Giant was born to play Fezzick.  And that's not even mentioning the great cameo by Billy Crystal.By following the spirit of the superb source material, The Princess Bride proved a winner. 10 out of 10.

title: God's gift to movies.
content: Without a doubt, the finest movie ever made. To quote Peter Falk in the movie, there is "fencing, fighting, torture, revenge, giants, monsters, chases, escapes, true love, miracles..."  Anyone who does not immediately fall in love with the movie should be checked for a pulse. A brilliantly acted, directed, cinematographed (?), and produced adaptation of William Goldman's great novel.  It needs to be seen to be believed!

title: Astounding Movie
content: This movie is definitely the best of all time. No other movie is worth watching over and over as many times as this and on top of that, to go and buy the movie again after losing it because it is THAT great. For all those who voted 1' and 2's, you are desperately deluded. I hope that you see the light sometime soon. . . To everyone else, Watch for the ROUS's

title: A Timeless Classic
content: I think of The Princess Bride as one of those "elite" movies that 20 years from now, people will still be watching.  A story that captures the imagination and characters that capture the heart are what make this movie great.  I recomend this to anyone who enjoys watching a good movie.

title: This is my favorite movie.
content: This movie is fabulous! It's been my favorite movie since I was five years old (I'm 13 now)! It may not have done so well at the box-office, but it's done great as far as rental and ppl buying it, and acknowledgement. It's funny, not too mushy, full of suspense and action, and has a fantastic cast. Everyone, any age, will love this movie! :)

title: Linear, banal, devoid of wit, facile, simpering and dull - dull - dull
content: I had not seen this film, until it was set as 'text' by my son's deluded English teacher. This film is OK for the small hours of the morning, if you have very low expectations - but a classic? Give me a break! Shakespeare's a classic, Dickens, Orwell, Steinbeck - all who would have turned in their graves at this abysmal, one-dimensional script writing. A Spanish character, finally enacting long sought-after revenge and what does the writer come up with? "Son of a bitch!" Really! That's the best, wittiest and most memorable line you can come up with? Come back Welles, Kurosawa, Copolla, Ford, Scott, Kubrick, Lang, Bunuel, Capra, Wyler, Curtiz, Weir, etc. SERIOUSLY SUBSTANDARD - STANDARDS ARE SLIPPING, FOLKS.

title: Fighting, torture, revenge, monsters, chases, true love...
content: It doesn't really get much better.  You literally have all the different styles of movies all rolled into one."Are you kidding? Fencing, fighting, torture, revenge, giants, monsters, chases, escapes, true love, miracles..."to quote the movie.  Wrap it all up and sprinkle with comedy... and there it is.  Quite possibly one of the best classic (cult?) movies around.

title: Imaginative Fun,
content: The Princess Bride is a great movie with a well developed plot and a terrific comedic cast. It's a fun, very imaginative film set in a fantasy world as a young man sets out to save his beloved princess. Rob Reiner brings this world to life very effectively and further displays his versatility as a director. I do not believe it would have worked out half as much without his involvement.However, I did find the plot itself light on any real excitement, it is far too dialogue heavy and did not move as quick as it should have. Films like Monty Python & The Holy Grail, which I am sure this movie took inspiration from, keeps its plot moving at all times, which is why I was bothered by how often this slowed down.The cast is top notch and enter in to the persona of these bizarre characters well, the likes of Cary Elwes, Robin Wright and Mandy Patinkin, as well as great cameos, such as an unforgettable few minutes with Billy Crystal, all come together to bring this eccentric universe to life.It did not hold back on its wacky characters and story, which I admired, it clearly never got any push from the studio to tone it down a little. Funny and with a top notch cast, The Princess Bride is worth the watch if you are looking for a good comedy.A grandfather reads his sick grandson a story involving a young farm boy setting out to save a kidnapped princess.Best Performance: Mandy Patinkin

title: A Great Movie
content: Inigo Montoya: "My name is Inigo Montoya.  You killed my father.  Prepare to die!"Immortal words spoken from the most heartfelt character, second only to Westley (the farm boy) in this film.This is an AWESOME film filled with adventure, revenge, and true love."As you wish" is the ear mark phrase bellowed by our hero as he sets out on his life adventures which eventually lead to fighting for his love.  The earmark phrase for is fist is "to the pain"... as he "battles" the despicable Humperdink in the quest to save his true love, Buttercup.If you have seen this film and don't think it is awesome I can't imagine what is so.  In any case I would heartily recommend this to any and all potential viewers.The closing words by Fred Savage as we finish the movie should serve as recommendation to all: "Grandpa, maybe you can come over and read it to me tomorrow."Which is how we would all feel about this beautiful story if our hearts let us.

title: Imponderable!
content: Writer William Goldman deserves plenty of credit for one of the most quotable films, presented as a book read by a grandfather (Peter Falk) to his grandson (Fred Savage). The story is a fairy tale suitable for viewers of most ages.The book tells of the abduction of a young princess for political purposes. The captors are pursued across land and water, and there are many trials for the would-be rescuer of Princess Buttercup (Robin Wright). Along the way, there is a giant, some swordplay, enormous rodents, battles of strength and wits, and other challenges.Expect plenty of charm and humor. The stand-out performances are too numerous to mention. The musical styling of Mark Knopfler adds strongly to the film's enchantment.
